verses.verse: And Miryam <WH4813> and Aharon <WH175> spake <WH1696> <WH8762> against Mosheh <WH4872> because of <WH182> the Ethiopian <WH3571> woman <WH802> whom he had married <WH3947> <WH8804>: for he had married <WH3947> <WH8804> an Ethiopian <WH3571> woman <WH802>.

And they said <WH559> <WH8799>, Hath the YY <WH3068> indeed spoken <WH1696> <WH8765> only by Mosheh <WH4872>? hath he not spoken <WH1696> <WH8765> also by us? And the YY <WH3068> heard <WH8085> <WH8799> it.
(Now the man <WH376> Mosheh <WH4872> was very <WH3966> meek <WH6035> <WH8675> <WH6035>, above all the men <WH120> which were upon the face <WH6440> of the earth <WH127>.)

And the YY <WH3068> spake <WH559> <WH8799> suddenly <WH6597> unto Mosheh <WH4872>, and unto Aharon <WH175>, and unto Miryam <WH4813>, Come out <WH3318> <WH8798> ye three <WH7969> unto the tabernacle <WH168> of the congregation <WH4150>. And they three <WH7969> came out <WH3318> <WH8799>.

And the YY <WH3068> came down <WH3381> <WH8799> in the pillar <WH5982> of the cloud <WH6051>, and stood <WH5975> <WH8799> in the door <WH6607> of the tabernacle <WH168>, and called <WH7121> <WH8799> Aharon <WH175> and Miryam <WH4813>: and they both <WH8147> came forth <WH3318> <WH8799>.

And he said <WH559> <WH8799>, Hear <WH8085> <WH8798> now my words <WH1697>: If there be a prophet <WH5030> among you, I the YY <WH3068> will make myself known <WH3045> <WH8691> unto him in a vision <WH4759>, and will speak <WH1696> <WH8762> unto him in a dream <WH2472>.
My servant <WH5650> Mosheh <WH4872> is not so, who is faithful <WH539> <WH8737> in all mine house <WH1004>.

With him will I speak <WH1696> <WH8762> mouth <WH6310> to mouth <WH6310>, even apparently <WH4758>, and not in dark speeches <WH2420>; and the similitude <WH8544> of the YY <WH3068> shall he behold <WH5027> <WH8686>: wherefore then were ye not afraid <WH3372> <WH8804> to speak <WH1696> <WH8763> against my servant <WH5650> Mosheh <WH4872> ?
And the anger <WH639> of the YY <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> <WH8799> against them; and he departed <WH3212> <WH8799>.

And the cloud <WH6051> departed <WH5493> <WH8804> from off the tabernacle <WH168>; and, behold, Miryam <WH4813> became leprous <WH6879> <WH8794>, white as snow <WH7950>: and Aharon <WH175> looked <WH6437> <WH8799> upon Miryam <WH4813>, and, behold, she was leprous <WH6879> <WH8794>.

And Aharon <WH175> said <WH559> <WH8799> unto Mosheh <WH4872>, Alas <WH994>, my lord <WH113>, I beseech thee, lay <WH7896> <WH8799> not the sin <WH2403> upon us, wherein we have done foolishly <WH2973> <WH8738>, and wherein we have sinned <WH2398> <WH8804>.

Let her not be as one dead <WH4994> <WH4191> <WH8801>, of whom the flesh <WH1320> is half <WH2677> consumed <WH398> <WH8735> when he cometh out <WH3318> <WH8800> of his mother's <WH517> womb <WH7358>.
And Mosheh <WH4872> cried <WH6817> <WH8799> unto the YY <WH3068>, saying <WH559> <WH8800>, Heal <WH7495> <WH8798> her now, O 'Elohim <WH410>, I beseech thee.

And the YY <WH3068> said <WH559> <WH8799> unto Mosheh <WH4872>, If her father <WH1> had but <WH3417> <WH8800> spit <WH3417> <WH8804> in her face <WH6440>, should she not be ashamed <WH3637> <WH8735> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>? let her be shut <WH5462> <WH8735> out <WH2351> from the camp <WH4264> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>, and after <WH310> that let her be received <WH622> <WH8735> in again.

And Miryam <WH4813> was shut <WH5462> <WH8735> out <WH2351> from the camp <WH4264> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>: and the people <WH5971> journeyed <WH5265> <WH8804> not till Miryam <WH4813> was brought <WH622> <WH8736> in again.
And afterward <WH310> the people <WH5971> removed <WH5265> <WH8804> from Hazeroth <WH2698>, and pitched <WH2583> <WH8799> in the wilderness <WH4057> of Paran <WH6290>.
